videos.title: 3-Ingredient Healthy Cookie Recipe
videos.description:
3-Ingredient Healthy Cookie Recipe

Today I'm going to show you how to make healthy banana oatmeal cookies.

These healthy cookies are so easy to make and taste absolutely delicious.

Oatmeal banana cookies are 100% sugar-free, egg-free, gluten-free and dairy-free, and can be served as healthy breakfast or snack.

üíöGet a FREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

Watch next:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pj2J64WM7X4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hd9kvibHqMM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HimuU_XRD4o

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uhn6fKkuWXY

Here's what you'll learn in today's video:

First, I'll show you how to make healthy oatmeal cookies, using only 3 simple ingredients.

Next, you'll see how to use different kind of oats for this same recipe. Here I'm using old-fashioned oats, quick oats, and combination of old-fashioned oats, quick oats and ground oats.

For these healthy cookies besides bananas and oats I use raisins, but you can feel free to replace raisins with chocolate chips, chopped walnuts or almonds, or different dried fruits.

Banana oatmeal cookies are perfect for school lunchboxes and as a healthy snack for your kids.

3-INGREDIENT BANANA OATMEAL COOKIES
Ingredients:
2 ripe bananas
1.5 cups old-fashioned oats (or quick oats) (135g)
1/3 cup raisins (50g)

Preparation:
In a bowl, mash the bananas using a fork, add oats and mix well until combined. If the mixture is too wet (which depends on the size of the bananas), add some more oats.

Add the raisins and give a final mix.

Scoop about 2 tablespoons of cookie mixture and spread on a lined baking sheet. Spread the mixture and using your hands form into a cookie shape.

For medium sized cookies bake for 12 minutes at 350 degrees. If making small cookies bake for 9 minutes, and for larger size cookies bake for 15-20 minutes.

When baked transfer to a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes, and they're ready to dig in.

Cool completely before storing in the box.

Enjoy!

videos.title: HEALTHY Peanut Butter Cookies. My NEW favorite cookie recipe!
videos.description:
Healthy Peanut Butter Cookies 

Today I'm going to show you how to make peanut butter cookies.

These 5 ingredient cookies are so easy to make, they're done in 20 minutes from scratch.

These peanut butter cookies are lower in calories than traditional ones, and they're made without eggs, butter or white sugar.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yT3SiIdOxW0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eoz1BkTX7Oo

This is why you'll love these gluten free peanut butter cookies:
They're so easy to make!
They use cheap and affordable ingredients!
They're lower in calories than traditional peanut butter cookies!
These can be made ahead!

PEANUT BUTTER COOKIE RECIPE
(makes 12 cookies)

Ingredients:
1/2 cup natural peanut butter (125g)
1/4 cup honey or agave (60ml)
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce (65g)
1 cup ground oats or oat flour (100g)
1.5 tbsp cornstarch or tapioca starch
1 tsp baking powder

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
107 calories, fat 2.3g, carb 19.9g, protein 2.4g

Preparation:
In a bowl, add room temperature peanut butter, your sweetener and applesauce, beat with the mixer for 1 minute.

Add half of the oats, cornstarch and baking powder, and gently mix it in, until the dough starts to form.

Add the rest of the oats and mix until everything comes together.

If the dough is too sticky to work with, place the cookie dough in the freezer for 5 minutes.

Scoop the cookie dough (35-40 grams) and roll with your hands, you'll end up with 12 equal balls.

Flatten a bit and transfer to a lined baking tray.

Using a fork, press down each cookie to create authentic criss cross marks.

Bake cookies at 350F (180C) for 10 minutes.

Let it cool on a baking sheet for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

When completely cool, serve and enjoy with your favorite milk.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Healthy Nutella Cookies (MADE WITH 3 INGREDIENTS ONLY!)
videos.description:
Healthy Nutella Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make 3-ingredient nutella cookies.

These 3 ingredient nutella cookies are nutritious and packed with delicious hazelnut flavor.

Also, in this recipe you'll see how to make homemade Nutella.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErhmoYxLEE0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xlSS04re9Io

This is why you'll love these nutella cookies:
You'll need only 3 ingredients to make these.
They are both chewy and soft.
You‚Äôd never know they‚Äôre gluten-free.
These take just 15 minutes from start to finish.

NUTELLA COOKIES RECIPE
(makes 10 cookies)

Ingredients:

Cookies:
1 cup homemade Nutella (or any healthier chocolate spread) (280g)
1 egg
1 cup ground oats or oat flour (100g)

Homemade Nutella:
1 cup roasted hazelnuts (130g)
1/4 cup pitted dates or date paste (75g)
1/4 cup dark chocolate chips (50g)
1 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
1 tbsp maple syrup or honey
2-3 tbsp coconut cream, coconut milk or heavy-whipping cream

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
182 calories, fat 11.1g, carb 19.3g, protein 4.4g

Preparation:
First make your homemade nutella, in a food processor add the roasted hazelnuts and blend until the oils from the nuts start to release.

Now, add the dates, melted dark chocolate, cocoa powder, maple syrup and coconut cream. Process until it's smooth to your liking.

In a medium sized bowl, add homemade nutella (measure 1 cup, there will be some left, use this for decoration), also add the egg and mix with the spatula until the egg is incorporated.

Gradually add the oats, and gently mix it in, until the dough is formed.

Let it chill in the fridge for 20 minutes, or if it doesn't stick start rolling the balls.

Roll with your hands, you'll end up with 10 equal balls, transfer the balls on a lined baking tray.

Using your spatula or bottom of your glass, press each ball down slightly, to flatten the cookies.

Make a well in the center of each cookie, using your finger.

Bake cookies at 350F (180C) for 8-10 minutes.

Let it cool in a tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack.

When completely cool, decorate with leftover homemade nutella, or your favorite fruit jam.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe (lower in calories!)
videos.description:
Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe

Today I'm going to show you how to make oatmeal chocolate chip cookies.

These healthier cookies are made with no butter, no oil and no flour! 

They're lower in calories compared to store bought cookies.

üíöGet a FREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tSQ945a41kM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MY-XZoG_bE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pj2J64WM7X4

This is why you'll love these healthy chocolate chip cookies:
They're so easy to make using pantry staples.
They're super soft and chewy.
They‚Äôre loaded with pockets of chocolate.
They're made with good for you ingredients.

OATMEAL COOKIE RECIPE
(Makes 11 cookies)
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups rolled oats (135g)
1/2 cup ground oats or oat flour (50g)
1 tsp baking powder
1 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce (125g)
1/4 cup maple syrup, honey or agave (60ml)
1/2 cup dark chocolate chips (80g)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
108 calories, fat 2.5g, carb 20.3g, protein 2.4g

Preparation:
In a bowl, combine the dry ingredients, rolled oats, ground oats, baking powder, ground cinnamon and salt.

In another bowl, add the applesauce and sweetener of your choice (maple syrup, honey or agave). Whisk well until combined.

Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir together until the sticky dough if formed.

Mix in the dark chocolate chips. 

Let the dough chill in the fridge for 20-30 minutes.

Line your cookie sheet with parchment paper. Using an ice cream scoop or 1/4 cup measure, scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet.

Flatten a cookies to about 1/2 inch thick.

Bake at 350F (180C) degrees for 12-14 minutes.

Let it cool for 5 minutes in a baking pan, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Healthy Gingerbread Cookies (SOFT and CHEWY - Gluten Free, No Butter)
videos.description:
Healthy Gingerbread Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make gingerbread cookies without molasses.

These healthier gingerbread cookies have no sugar, no white flour and no butter.

They're more nutritious than regular Christmas cookies, and you can enjoy these without feeling guilty.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eoz1BkTX7Oo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e1wl7HDOd4I

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xlSS04re9Io

This is why you'll love these gingerbread man cookies:
They're soft in the center, but crispy on the edges.
They're packed with holiday spices.
They're great recipe to make with your family.
They're gluten free and almost vegan.

GINGERBREAD COOKIE RECIPE
(makes 12 cookies)

Ingredients:
2 cups ground oats or oat flour (200g)
1/4 cup tapioca starch or cornstarch (30g)
1 tsp ground cinnamon
1 tsp ground ginger
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
1/4 tsp ground cloves
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/4 cup maple syrup (60ml)
2 tbsp unsweetened applesauce
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 egg

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
97 calories, fat 1.4g, carb 18.4g, protein 2.5g

Healthier icing:
2 tbsp coconut cream
2 tbsp extra virgin coconut oil
1/2 tbsp tapioca starch
1/2 tbsp powdered coconut sugar

Preparation:
In a medium sized bowl, mix the dry ingredients, oats, tapioca, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, salt and baking soda. Set aside.

In another bowl, add maple syrup, applesauce, vanilla extract and egg or flax egg. Whisk it up well.

Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, and using a wooden spoon mix until the dough starts to form.

Tranfer the dough to a working surface, and gently knead into a ball. Shape into a disc, wrap it up in foil and place in the fridge for 1 hour.

When chilled, place the dough between two pieces of parchment paper and roll into the 1/4 inch thick.

Cut with your favorite cookie cutter and line the cookies onto a lined baking tray.

Bake cookies at 350F (180C) for 8-10 minutes.

Let it cool in a tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack.

When completely cool, decorate with melted dark chocolate or this healthier icing.

Enjoy!

videos.title: 1 Minute Chocolate Chip Cookie (HEALTHY and TASTY! made in a mug)
videos.description:
1 Minute Chocolate Chip Cookie

Today I'm going to show you how to make chocolate chip cookie in a mug.

This is the easiest cookie to make, and it has more nutrition and fewer calories than classic cookie of this size.

It's so soft and gooey and chocolatey.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e1wl7HDOd4I

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xlSS04re9Io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pj2J64WM7X4

This is why you'll love this 1 minute cookie:
It's super quick and easy to make.
It's filled with melty chocolate pockets.
It's a single serving, great for portion control.
It's so soft and gooey in texture.

1 MINUTE CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE RECIPE
(makes 1 cookie)

Ingredients (classic version):
2 tbsp unsweetened applesauce
1/2 tbsp maple syrup, honey or agave
1/8 tsp salt
1/2 tsp vanilla paste or vanilla extract
1 egg yolk
1/4 cup ground oats or oat flour (25g)
1 tbsp dark chocolate chips

Ingredients (eggless version):
2 tbsp unsweetened applesauce
1/2 tbsp maple syrup, honey or agave
1/8 tsp salt
1/2 tsp vanilla paste or vanilla extract
1 tbsp milk (dairy or non-dairy)
1/4 cup ground oats or oat flour (25g)
1 tbsp dark chocolate chips

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie - classic version):
224 calories, fat 8.1g, carb 31.8g, protein 6.3g

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie - eggless version):
178 calories, fat 3.9g, carb 31.9g, protein 4.1g

Preparation:
In a coffee mug, add the applesauce, liquid sweetener of your choice, salt, vanilla, egg yolk (or milk for eggless version), and mix together.

Add the ground oats, and mix using a fork until a smooth batter is formed.  Make sure there are no lumps on the bottom of the mug. 

Stir in the dark chocolate chips and sprinkle some on top.

Microwave on medium for 40-60 seconds, it depends on your microwave, but don't overcook it.

Let it cool for 3 minutes, then dig in.

Enjoy!

HOMEMADE HEALTHY NUTELLA
Ingredients: 
1 cup dry roasted hazelnuts
1 cup dates
2 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
water to soak the dates (just to cover)
Preparation:
Soak the dates, then place all the ingredients into the food processor. Blend for 5-10 minutes until smooth in texture.

videos.title: COCONUT MACAROONS everyone should try! One of the easiest HEALTHY desserts you can make.
videos.description:
Coconut Macaroons 

Today I'm going to show you how to make coconut macaroons without condensed milk.

These healthy coconut macaroons are the perfect sweet treat for any occasion. 

They're naturally sweetened, moist and rich in coconut flavor.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZZxC1wfRAc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-N0zaT6hf4w

This is why you'll love these low sugar coconut macaroons:
These are refined sugar-free type of macaroons!
They're so easy to make!
They're moist and just enough chewy on the inside!
They're packed with rich coconut flavor!

COCONUT MACAROONS RECIPE
(makes 12 cookies)

Ingredients:
2 egg whites
3 tbsp maple syrup, honey or agave
1/2 tsp vanilla extract
1/4 tsp salt
2 cups shredded or desiccated coconut (150g)
1/4 cup ground oats or oat flour (25g)
2 tbsp dark chocolate chips (25g), optional

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
104 calories, fat 7.9g, carb 7.4g, protein 1.6g

Preparation:
In a bowl, add room temperature egg whites, your sweetener, vanilla extract and salt. Beat with a fork until slightly foamy.

Add the coconut and oats and mix it in, until the mixture is nice and sticky.

Using a cookie scoop, scoop out the mixture onto a lined baking tray. If it's falling apart, form the cookie shape with your fingers.

Bake at 325F (160C) for 20 minutes.

Let it cool completely in a tray (or at least 30 minutes), to firm up.

Drizzle with melted dark chocolate.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie everyone can make! LAZY BUT HEALTHY RECIPE!
videos.description:
Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie

Today I'm going to show you how to make chocolate chip cookie in a skillet.

Making this skillet cookie is so easier than any other regular cookies.

This is the perfect lazy baking recipe.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5sgAF5s7hj8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GPFcMBs6JVw

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

This is why you'll love this cookie in a skillet:
It takes only 5 minutes to whip up!
It's crispy on the edges, and soft and chewy in the center!
It's made in one bowl!
It's made of simple wholesome ingredients!

CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE SKILLET RECIPE
(makes 8 pieces)

Ingredients:
1/3 cup unsweetened applesauce (85g)
1/3 cup maple syrup, honey or agave (80ml)
1/4 cup ricotta cheese (70g)
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 egg or flax egg
2 cups ground oats or oat flour (200g)
2 tbsp tapioca or cornstarch
2 tsp baking powder
1/2 cup chopped dark chocolate (80g)
2 tbsp dark chocolate chips

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per piece):
210 calories, fat 5.6g, carb 36.6g, protein 5.4g

Preparation:
In a bowl, add the applesauce, liquid sweetener of your choice, ricotta cheese, vanilla, egg , and mix together.

Add the ground oats, cornstarch, baking powder and salt, and mix using a spatula until a smooth cookie batter is formed.  Make sure there are no lumps on the bottom of the bowl. 

Stir in the dark chocolate and pour into a greased skillet, and spread evenly. Sprinkle with chocolate chips on top.

Bake at 350F (180C) for 16-20 minutes.

Let it cool for 10 minutes, then dig in straight from the skillet, or cut into slices and serve individually.

Enjoy!

videos.title: No Bake Oatmeal Cookies (HEALTHY ENOUGH TO BE EATEN FOR BREAKFAST!)
videos.description:
No Bake Oatmeal Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make no bake cookies.

These healthy oatmeal cookies are one of the easiest cookies to make, and will satisfy all your cookie cravings.

They're made with less sugar and less fat than traditional, so it makes a great breakfast cookie.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18cOu-WdCrM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4EwFQWUPcY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZZxC1wfRAc

This is why you'll love these healthy no bake cookies:
They're healthy enough to be eaten for breafkast!
They're so easy and quick to make!
They store really well!
They're packed with fiber and healthy fats!

NO BAKE COOKIES RECIPE
(makes 12 cookies)

Ingredients:
1/2 cup rolled oats (45g)
1/2 cup quick cooking oats (50g)
1/2 cup shredded coconut (75g)
1 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
1/2 cup natural peanut butter (125g)
1/3 cup chopped dark chocolate (65g)
3 tbsp honey or maple syrup
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce (65g)
1/4 cup milk, dairy or non-dairy (60ml)
1 tsp vanilla extract
flaky sea salt for sprinkling (optional)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
152 calories, fat 8.5g, carb 16.2g, protein 5g

Preparation:
Sprad your oats onto a baking pan and bake at 350F (180C) for 5-10 minutes, just to toast your oats and give some flavor.

In a saucepan, add room temperature peanut butter, chopped dark chocolate, your sweetener, applesauce and milk, and place on medium heat, until melted and smooth.

Take off the heat, add the vanilla and cocoa powder and stir until the cocoa powder is all dissolved.

Add the oats and shredded coconut, and stir well, until the sticky mixture is formed.

Scoop the cookie mixture (about 2 tbsp) and place onto a lined baking tray, and flatten into a round circle using a back of your spoon. You'll end up with 12 equal balls.

Sprinkle with some flaky salt if you want.

Place in the fridge for 2 hours, or overnight, to set and let the oats to soften.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Homemade Graham Crackers That Taste Better Than Store-Bought
videos.description:
Homemade Graham Crackers

Today I'm going to show you how to make graham crackers at home.

These healthy graham crackers are made with less sugar and less fat than regular.

Oatmeal graham crackers are great as a snack, but they're also good as a breakfast.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSR9Ose40Bo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uDx8h0eLHqE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

This is why you'll love these graham crackers:
Taste better than store-bought crackers!
They're super easy and quick to make!
They're lower in fat and sugar!
They're great for snack or even breakfast!

HOMEMADE GRAHAM CRACKERS RECIPE
(makes 15 crackers)
Ingredients:
1 cup ground oats or oat flour (100g)
1 cup whole wheat flour (100g)
1 tbsp tapioca or cornstarch
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp salt
3 tbsp butter (45g)
3 tbsp unsweetened applesauce
1/4 cup honey or maple syrup (60ml)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cracker):
92 calories, fat 2.8g, carb 15g, protein 1.7g

Preparation:

In a mixing bowl, mix the dry ingredients (oats, whole wheat flour, cornstarch, baking soda, cinnamon and salt). Grate the cold butter and mix it in.

On a side, combine the wet ingredients, applesauce and honey.

Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture, and mix with a wooden spoon, until the dough starts to form. Cover and let it rest for 10 minutes.

Transfer the dough onto a working sufrace and gently press couple of times.

Roll out the dough between two pieces of parchment paper.

Cut into crackers using a ruller and pizza cutter. Transfer the whole sheet into a baking tray, and give it a quick freeze (10-15 minutes).

Bake at 350F (180C) for 15 minutes. Let it cool in the tray for 10 minutes, then transfer onto a cooling rack. 

Enjoy!

videos.title: Breakfast Cookies: The Best Way to Start Your Day
videos.description:
Breakfast Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make oatmeal breakfast cookies.

These oatmeal cookies are packed with protein and fiber, so you can enjoy them for breakfast or as a snack on the go.

Each cookie has less than 100 calories and more than 4g of protein.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QMM30Nu8uNU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=350B5YYdcRI

This is why you'll love these healthy breakfast cookies:

They're easy to make in a bowl!
They're packed with nutrition!
They're one of the best tasting oatmeal cookies!
There's so many variations of this cookie (using different mix-ins)!

BREAKFAST COOKIES RECIPE
(makes 16 cookies)
Ingredients:
2 cups rolled oats (180g)
2 tbsp ground oats, or oat flour
2 tbsp flaxseed meal
1 tsp baking powder
1/4 cup maple syrup, honey or agave (60ml)
1 cup ricotta cheese (250g)
2 egg whites
2 tbsp unsweetened applesauce
1/3 cup almond flakes (30g)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
95 calories, fat 3.2g, carb 12.4g, protein 4.2g, total sugars 3.4g

Preparation:
In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients, rolled oats, oat flour, flaxseed meal and baking powder.

In another bowl, mix the wet ingredients, sweetener, ricotta cheese, egg whites and applesauce.

Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and mix just until combined.

Add the almond flakes and stir to combine. Let the dough rest for 10 minutes.

Scoop the cookie dough onto a lined baking tray and press gently to form a cookie (about 1/2 inch thick).

Bake at 350F (180C) for 15 minutes.

Let them cool in the baking tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack and let the cookies set for 30 minutes.

Serve with a glass of cold milk. 

Enjoy for breakfast or snack.

videos.title: HOMEMADE OREOS I would choose over store-bought any day
videos.description:
Homemade Oreos

Today I'm going to show you how to make homemade oreo cookies.

I made these cookies gluten free using just oats, and they're made without any oil or white sugar.

This recipe is my way of making healthy oreos that can be enjoyed every day.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CmHeB20d0QE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vofpCtCQTEk

This is why you'll love these gluten free oreo cookies:

They're great alternative for store-bought oreos!
They're crisp, not soft and chewy!
They're delicious and rich in chocolate flavor!
They're super easy to make!

HOMEMADE OREOS RECIPE
(makes 25 cookies)

Ingredients:
Cookies:
1 cup ground oats or oat flour (100g)
2 tbsp cornstarch or tapioca starch
1/2 cup cocoa powder (50g)
1/4 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
2.5 tbsp maple syrup
2 tbsp melted butter
1 egg
2 tbsp unsweetened applesauce

Filling:
1/2 cup cream cheese (110g)
2 tbsp butter or coconut butter
1 tbsp honey
1.5 tsp tapioca starch

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
48 calories, fat 2.5g, carb 6.4g, protein 1g

Preparation:
In a bowl, add the oats, cornstarch, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt, mix to combine.

In another bowl, add the maple syrup, melted butter, egg and applesauce, and whisk it all up.

Incorporate the dry ingredients with wet ingredients, and gently mix it in, until the dough starts to form.

Knead just a couple of times, cover and let it chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.

Place the dough on a piece of parchement paper, cover with another piece of paper and roll it out thin, about 1/4 inch thick.

Using a cookie cutter or small glass cut out the cookies and layer on a lined baking tray.

Bake at 350F (180C) for about 12 minutes.

Let it cool in a tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

For filling, in a small bowl mix together cream cheese, butter (coconut butter), honey and tapioca starch, and put it in the fridge to firm up.

Using a butter knife or small spoon spread the filling on one cookie, top with another cookie and press gently.

Serve your homemade oreos with cup of cold milk or coffee.

Enjoy!

videos.title: PUMPKIN COOKIES that I will be making again and again
videos.description:
Pumpkin Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make chewy pumpkin cookies.

These healthy cookies are lower in fat and sugar than traditional, but they're so good.

These easy pumpkin cookies are a great way to switch up your pumpkin game.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XyoXTh-HIy4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XOgbMYv1sY

This is why you'll love these gluten free pumpkin cookies:

They're soft and chewy, just like the regular cookies!
They're low in fat and sugar!
They're great for using leftover pumpkin puree!
They're super easy to make!

PUMPKIN COOKIES RECIPE
(makes 15 cookies)
Ingredients:
2 cups ground oats or oat flour (200g)
1/4 cup rice flour (35g)
1/4 cup tapioca or cornstarch (35g)
1 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp cinnamon
1 tsp pumpkin spice (*recipe below)
1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce (130g)
1/4 cup melted butter (60ml)
1/4 cup agave, maple syrup or honey (60ml)
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 egg yolk
1 cup pumpkin puree (250g)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
120 calories, fat 4.3g, carb 18.4g, protein 2.2g

RICOTTA CHEESE FROSTING:
1/2 cup ricotta cheese
2 tbsp Greek yogurt
1 tsp honey
1 tbsp lemon juice

HOMEMADE PUMPKIN SPICE:
4 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp nutmeg, 1 tsp ginger, 1 tsp cloves, 1 tsp allspice

Preparation:
In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients, ground oats, rice flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and pumpkin spice.

In another bowl, whisk the wet ingredients, applesauce, melted butter, sweetener, vanilla extract, egg yolk and pumpkin puree.

Pour the dry ingredients into the wet, and gently mix just until the flour is incorporated, no more that that.

Let the dough chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.

Scoop the cookie dough, place it on a prepared baking sheet and flatten down into a cookie shape with your fingers.

Bake for at 350¬∞F (180¬∞C) for 15 minutes.

Let it cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Serve with ricotta cheese filling on top.

Enjoy!

videos.title: I made healthier CHOCOLATE CRINKLE COOKIES for the holidays
videos.description:
Chocolate Crinkle Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make chocolate crinkle cookies.

These holiday crinkle cookies are my healthy take on traditional chocolate crinkles.

My crinkle cookies are soft and chewy, and loaded with delicious cocoa flavor.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZZxC1wfRAc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VNF4aVJTiEM

This is why you'll love these healthy chocolate crinkle cookies:

They're super easy to make!
They're budget friendly holiday cookies!
They come with more nutrition than traditional crinkle cookies!
They're not too sweet and rich in chocolate flavor!

CHOCOLATE CRINKLE COOKIE RECIPE
(makes 12 cookies)

Ingredients:
1/2 cup ground oats or oat flour (50g)
1/2 cup spelt flour (65g)
1 tbsp tapioca starch or cornstarch
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 cup honey or agave (60ml)
1/4 cup softened butter (60g)
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce (65g)
1 egg
1/2 cup cocoa powder (50g)
1/4 cup each - powdered sugar and tapioca starch for dusting

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
102 calories, fat 5g, carb 13.9g, protein 2.4g

Preparation:
In a bowl, add the ground oats, spelt flour, tapioca or cornstarch, baking powder and salt. Mix to combine.

In another bowl, add your liquid sweetener and softened butter, and cream with a mixer for 20 seconds. Then add vanilla extract and applesauce, and mix it up again. Add one egg and mix.

Now sift in the cocoa powder and mix well with a mixer until the smooth dark paste is formed.

Add the dry ingredients and mix just until combined, the dough will be sticky.

Cover with a foil and place in the fridge for 2-3 hours, or overnight.

Scoop the dough using a tablespoon, roll into the balls, spread a bit into a disk shape and coat with a sugar/tapioca mix.

Layer on a prepared baking tray and bake at 350F (180C) for 8-10 minutes (depends on your oven).

Let it cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.

Store in your cookie box.

Enjoy!

videos.title: PEANUT BUTTER BLOSSOMS the BEST healthy holiday cookies
videos.description:
Peanut Butter Blossoms 

Today I'm going to show you how to make peanut butter blossoms.

These healthier peanut butter blossom cookies are made 100% from scratch, with homemade dark chocolate kisses.

These holiday cookies are gluten-free, lower in fat (I don't use any butter or oil), but still festive and delicious.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy] 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook/

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nz9hl1_SU38

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VNF4aVJTiEM

This is why you'll love these gluten free peanut butter blossoms:

They're so easy to make all from scratch!
They're delicious and also nutritious!
These can be made for all the holidays, and any time of the year!
You can make the dough ahead and bake some other day!

PEANUT BUTTER BLOSSOM COOKIE RECIPE
(makes 16 cookies)

Ingredients:
For cookies:
1 1/4 cups ground oats or oat flour (125g)
1/4 cup rice flour (37.5g)
1 tbsp tapioca starch or cornstarch
3/4 tsp baking soda
1 tsp salt
1/4 cup honey, maple syrup or agave (60ml)
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce (65g)
1/2 cup natural peanut butter (125g)
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
For chocolate kisses:
3 oz dark chocolate (85g)
2.5 tbsp heavy cream or coconut milk (35ml)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
129 calories, fat 5.4g, carb 15.1g, protein 4.8g

Preparation:
First, prepare the chocolate kisses. In a small bowl add the chopped dark chocolate and pour with a boiling hot heavy cream or coconut milk.

Let it sit for 2-3 minutes, then stir until smooth chocolate ganache is formed.

Now you should wait until the ganache is thick enough to be piped, and it depends on the chocolate you use. Then transfer the ganache into a piping bag, and pipe in shape of original Hershey kisses, it doesn't have to be perfect. 

Let it set for 30 minutes at room temperature, and put it in the freezer while the cookies are baking.

Next, in a bowl, add room temperature peanut butter, your liquid sweetener and applesauce, beat with the mixer for 1 minute.

Add vanilla extract and egg, and continue to beat with a mixer.

In separate bowl combine all the dry ingredients, ground oats, rice flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt.

Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, and mix with a mixer on low speed, until the dough starts to form.

Place the cookie dough in the fridge for 30 minutes to rest.

Scoop the cookie dough with tablepoon and roll with your hands, you'll end up with 16 equal balls.

Flatten into a cookie shape and transfer to a lined baking tray.

Bake cookies at 350F (180C) for 7 minutes.

While the cookies are warm, press a chocolate kiss into each cookie.

When completely cool, serve or store in your cookie box.

Enjoy!

videos.title: These almond BISCOTTI are my favorite AIR-FRYER cookies (Gluten free made with oats!)
videos.description:
Almond Biscotti - Air Fryer Cookies 

Today I'm going to show you how to make healthy almond biscotti.

These easy to make biscotti are lower in fat and sugar than traditional biscotti.

These air fryer cookies are super crunchy, perfect for dipping into coffee or hot chocolate.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy]
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KFINB0fX7oM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZZxC1wfRAc

This is why you'll love these gluten free biscotti:

They're low in fat and sugar!
They're so simple to make!
These cookies store really well!
These can be made with different nuts or dried fruits!

üíöFREE ebook: 5 Ways to Turn ANY Treat Into a Delicious Healthy Recipe: 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-ebook/

ALMOND BISCOTTI RECIPE
(makes 8 cookies)

Ingredients:
1 cup ground oats or oat flour (100g)
1/4 cup almond meal (35g)
1 tbsp cornstarch or tapioca starch
1/2 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
1 egg
2 tbsp agave or maple syrup
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/4 cup chopped almonds (40g)

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
117 calories, fat 5.3g, carb 14g, protein 3.9g

Preparation:
In a bowl, combine oat flour, almond meal, cornstarch, baking powder and salt.

In another bowl, add room temperature egg, your sweetener and vanilla extract, beat with the mixer for 1 minute.

Add the dry ingredients into the wet and genly mix just until the dough is formed.

Let it chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.

Transfer on a parchment paper and press with a hands into rectangle.

Bake in the air-fryer for 12 minutes at 360F (180C).

Let it cool for 15 minutes, then slice into biscotti.

Layer biscotti cut side down and air-fry for another 10 minutes at 300F (150F), flip halfway through.

Transfer biscotti on a wire rack and let cool to crisp up even more.

Enjoy!

videos.title: How to make soft, fluffy lemon cookies that are also healthy!
videos.description:
Lemon Cookies

Today I'm going to show you how to make lemon cookies with ricotta cheese.

These lemon ricotta cookies are packed with protein and fiber, so you can eat then anytime of the day.

These healthy cookies are proof that ricotta cheese is so underrated.

üíöFREE ebook: Healthy Lifestyle Simplified (5 Mistakes to Avoid for Better Health) 
https://howtocooksmarter.com/free-guide/

üìö My new recipe book [HOWTOCOOKSMARTER: 50 Recipes That Will Make You Feel Happy and Healthy]
https://howtocooksmarter.com/cookbook

WATCH NEXT:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KFINB0fX7oM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d__JHwSvLUk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KncjX-uLDmU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZZxC1wfRAc

This is why you'll love these gluten free lemon cookies:

They're super soft and delicious!
They're packed with nutrition!
You can make these cookies in different flavors too!
You can eat these cookies for breakfast!

LEMON COOKIES RECIPE
(makes 25 cookies)
Ingredients:
3 cups ground oats or oat flour (300g)
1/4 cup tapioca or cornstarch (30g)
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 cup melted butter (60ml)
1/2 cup maple syrup, honey or agave (120ml)
2 eggs
1.5 cups ricotta cheese (400g)
1/4 cup lemon juice (60ml)
1 tbsp lemon zest

NUTRITIONAL INFO (per cookie):
109 calories, fat 4.2g, carb 13.9g, protein 3.7g, total sugars 3.9g

Preparation:
In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients, oat flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda and salt.

In another bowl, mix the wet ingredients, melted butter, sweetener, ricotta cheese, lemon juice and lemon zest.

Pour the dry mixture into the wet ingredients and mix just until combined. Let the dough rest for 10 minutes.

Scoop the sticky dough onto a lined baking tray.

Bake at 350F (180C) for 12-14 minutes.

Let it cool in the baking tray for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack and let it set for at least 1 hour.

Drizzle with Greek yogurt glaze, just combine 3 tbsp Greek yogurt, 1/2 tbsp lemon juice and 1 tsp honey. 

Enjoy for breakfast or snack!
